title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win an £80,000 tour of Italy
text: Our readers’ love of Italy is reflected in its dominance in the Telegraph Travel Awards. The grand tour of Italy has been followed by the British since the 17th century. From Milan to the Bay of Naples, this three-week prize for two people delivers a modern version, with stops in Venice, Rome and Tuscany, where the winner will experience exclusive, once-in-a-lifetime experiences (return flights from Britain included). How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . Highlights of the itinerary Venice Baglioni Hotel Luna is one of the oldest hotels in the city and just moments from St Mark’s Square. The hotel’s San Giorgio Terrace Suite has breathtaking views of the canals and San Giorgio Island. You will also enjoy a private tour of the Doge’s Palace, hosted by Art Tours. The palace is one of Venice’s iconic landmarks, the residence of the senior official of Venice and steeped in history. Visitors will be shown around the palace and private apartments, discovering spectacular pieces of Renaissance art. Milan Baglioni Hotel Carlton is located in Milan, the fashion and design capital of the world and is the only hotel with an entrance on Via della Spiga, the city’s most prestigious shopping street. The hotel is just a stone’s throw away from the Duomo and the Teatro alla Scala and within easy reach of the Prada Foundation and Armani Silos. Rome Baglioni Hotel Regina is one of the finest properties in Rome. Formerly home to Queen Margherita of Savoy, the hotel is just a few minutes’ walk from the city’s main attractions such as Piazza di Spagna, Via Condotti, Trevi Fountain and the Villa Borghese Gardens. All of its rooms and suites are decorated in a gorgeous Art Deco style with antique furniture, fabulous silk tapestries and marble floors. In Rome you will also enjoy a Michelin-starred dinner in Aroma Restaurant located on a terrace on the top floor of the hotel Palazzo Manfredi, a 17th-century residence facing the Colosseum and offering breathtaking views over the Eternal City. Aroma is open at sunset for the ultimate romantic dinner. Florence Relais Santa Croce, a Baglioni Hotel, is an 18th-century residence in the centre of Florence. Once owned by the treasurer to the Pope, this Relais & Châteaux property has 24 elegantly decorated rooms and suites. While in the city you will be taken on a private visit to Villa Medici with Art Tours. Located on the Florentine hills, this stunning private villa was Lorenzo the Magnificent’s favourite residence. Never normally open to the public, Villa Medici has incredible views of Florence and sumptuous interiors. Punta Ala Baglioni Hotel Cala del Porto in Punta Ala has magnificent views of the Tuscan Archipelago: Elba, Montecristo and Cerboli. Its location allows visitors to take advantage of some of the most stunning beaches in Italy. Close to the seaside town of Castiglione della Pescaia, this is where the Italians like to holiday. The hotel has a large swimming pool, two restaurants and its own private sandy beach, La Vela. Bay of Naples Overlooking the Bay of Naples on the site of the villa of Emperor Caesar Augustus, the Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria on the Amalfi coast has a rich history of hosting musicians, writers and artists and is the perfect venue from which to explore Pompeii and Herculaneum, Naples and Capri. The hotel has a fine collection of antiques and artefacts collected over its 180-year history and also houses Michelin-starred Terrazza Bosquet, with spectacular views of the Vesuvius. In Pompeii you will take a guided tour by Art Tours to discover one of the world’s largest archaeological sites. Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria in Sorrento Capri Capri is one of the most exclusive islands in the Mediterranean, and Punta Tragara is a perfect place from which to explore. Overlooking the Faraglioni rocks, this boutique hotel encompasses the timeless beauty of Capri, with panoramic views, a spa and two restaurants. Punta Tragara in Capri What’s included One winning entrant will win a three-week Grand Tour of Italy for two adults. The prize package comprises: Baglioni Hotel Luna, Venice: two complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in the best available suite Baglioni Hotel Carlton, Milan: two complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in the best available suite Baglioni Hotel Regina, Rome: three complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in the Regina Suite Dinner at Michelin starred restaurant Aroma at Palazzo Manfredi in Rome for two people Transport by train between the properties for two people Relais Santa Croce, Florence: three complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in best available suite Baglioni Hotel Cala del Porto, Punta Ala: Four complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in best available suite Transport by train between the properties for two people Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria, Sorrento: four complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in best available suite Return airport transfer from/to Naples Airport Hotel Punta Tragara, Capri: three complimentary nights on a b&b basis, stay in best available suite Return airport transfer from/to Naples Airport Private guided tour of Doge’s Palace in Venice by Art Tours Private visit of Villa Medici by Art Tours Guided tour of Pompeii by Art Tours Up to two return economy flights for two people The Prize Providers Baglioni Hotels Forty years ago the Polito family created Baglioni Hotels, which has become the only truly authentic Italian luxury hotel brand owning properties in Venice, Rome, Milan and Tuscany. Each palazzo is located in the heart of the city with beautiful views and is either a member of Leading Hotels of the World or Relais & Châteaux. Baglioni Hotel Cala del Porto, the original Baglioni hotel, is a Tuscan treasure with stunning grounds overlooking the marina. It’s a 15-minute walk from its La Vela Beach Club and Restaurant, located on a stretch of white beach ( baglionihotels.com ). Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria Grand Hotel Excelsior Vittoria, in a magical position on the former villa of Caesar Augustus overlooking the Bay of Naples, has been in the Fiorentino family for 180 years ( exvitt.it ). Manfredi Hotels Punta Tragara was built as a villa in the Twenties and was a favourite of Churchill and Eisenhower. It enjoys one of the most spectacular locations on Capri ( hoteltragara.com ). Art Tours James McDonough created Art Tours ( arttoursltd.com ) for travellers to discover the hidden secrets of Italy with bespoke experiences. Telegraphtravel
